content.question: Which of the following is true about gross domestic product <math alttext="open parenthesis, G D P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>GDP</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: Calculations of <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> include the monetary value of non-market production activities such as households preparing their own meals at home.
Calculations of <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> do not include the monetary value of production activities.

Calculations of <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> include the monetary value of illegal production activities such as drug cartels.
Calculations of <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> include the sale of used goods.
Calculations of <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> include the unsold inventories of goods produced within the borders of the country.

content.answer: Calculations of <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> include the unsold inventories of goods produced within the borders of the country.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
